subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Druids: The Lost Priests of the Celts
description: A fast breakdown of Druids: The Lost Priests of the Celts for builders.

hook.text: They wrote nothing down. Everything was memorized. When the Druids died, their knowledge died with them. Almost.

buildup.text: Druids were the priests, judges, and scholars of Celtic society. Training took up to 20 years of oral memorization.

discovery.text: They held rituals in oak groves, revered nature, and may have practiced human sacrifice. Roman writers said so.

twist.text: Romans destroyed Druidism deliberately. Caesar saw them as dangerous. Our knowledge comes mostly from their enemies.

climax.text: Modern Druids are a reconstruction, not a continuation. The original tradition was erased. We're guessing at the rest.

punchline.text: Druids wrote nothing down. Rome erased them. We guess at what's lost.

quiz.question: Why do we know so little about the Druids?
options: They preserved knowledge orally and Romans destroyed their tradition
